title: Litton guides Bangladesh to win over Hong Kong in Asia Cup T20
byline: Skipper Litton Das top-scored with 59 as Bangladesh beat a spirited Hong Kong by seven wickets in their first match of the Asia Cup on Thursday.

title: Brazil’s former President Bolsonaro sentences to 27 years over coup plot
byline: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has been sentenced to 27 years and three months in prison, shortly after a majority of a Supreme Court panel voted to convict him on charges related to an attempted military coup.

title: China covers entire school uniform need for 2026
byline: The Chinese government has agreed to provide the entire quantity of school uniform materials required for 2026 as a grant to Sri Lanka, covering all students in government and government-aided schools, the Ministry of Education said yesterday.

title: Ella bus accident: Bus owner overspent on design, Neglected maintenance
byline: The owner of the bus involved in the recent Ella tragedy, which killed 15 people and seriously injured many others, spent more on decorating the bus than its actual value, but had not properly maintained it, Nuwara Eliya District Chief Motor Vehicle Inspector Jaliya Bandara said.

title: Police constable arrested for accepting bribe from businessman
byline: A Police constable attached to the Karathivu Police Station in Ampara has been arrested by the Bribery Commission for allegedly accepting a bribe of Rs. 10,000 from a businessman.

title: Three-tier ADR in the works to boost investor confidence: BOI
byline: Sri Lanka is overhauling its investor agreements with a three-tier dispute resolution mechanism, negotiation, mediation, and arbitration, as part of efforts to strengthen foreign investor confidence, the

title: Woman arrested for attempted smuggling of exotic snakes at BIA
byline: A 40-year-old Sri Lankan woman was arrested by customs officers while attempting to smuggle six live exotic snakes into the country at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA).

title: Unsung Rajeew gets his loudest call
byline: One of the country’s silent warriors in rugby, Rajeew Perera, has received a call-up to be the team manager and assistant coach of the Sri Lanka Sevens squad that is faced with an important schedule ahead.

title: Sujeewa Senasinghe withdraws notice for Israel–Sri Lanka friendship association
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Parliamentarian Sujeewa Senasinghe has withdrawn a letter convening the inaugural meeting of a proposed Sri Lanka–Israel Parliamentary Friendship Association, acknowledging it was issued in error.

title: ‘I will move in two months’ time’- CBK
byline: In the wake of the enactment of the Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Act, former president Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga who governed between 1994 and 2005, said that she would vacate her official residence in two months’ time.

title: New policy could halt dog sterilisation, lead to mass culling: AWC warns
byline: The Animal Welfare Coalition (AWC) has raised concerns that the Health Ministry, in collaboration with the World Health Organisation (WHO), is formulating a policy to implement only rabies vaccination programmes instead of dog sterilisation, a move they warned could increase the stray dog population and ultimately lead to mass culling.

title: Ex-team selector Pramodya over the moon
byline: Sri Lanka step into the 2025 Asia Cup with a sense of genuine optimism and memories of 2022, when the islanders stunned the cricketing world to lift the trophy. Former chairman of team selectors Pramodya Wickremasinghe believes the current squad is well equipped to repeat that achievement.

title: Brazil’s former President Bolsonaro sentences to 27 years over coup plot
byline: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has been sentenced to 27 years and three months in prison, shortly after a majority of a Supreme Court panel voted to convict him on charges related to an attempted military coup.

title: Palm oil ban deepens forex drain for SL, industry warns
byline: The ban on palm oil cultivation has cost the country millions in foreign exchange and risks worsening its fragile economic recovery, the Planters’ Association of Ceylon (PA) said, urging the government to reverse

title: Ceylon Chamber pushes private sector-led growth in National Budget 2026 proposals
byline: The Ceylon Chamber of Commerce (CCC) yesterday presented its priority proposals for the National Budget 2026 during its first official meeting of the new board with President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Sri Lanka faces crisis if Parata Act unchecked
byline: The government risks losing 51% of its GDP contribution and facing an economic crisis if it fails to directly intervene in the implementation of the ’Parata Act,’ which allows banks to seize properties of businessmen who have defaulted on loans, Susantha Liyanarachchi, Media Spokesperson of the Sri Lanka Chamber of Commerce’s Small and Medium Enterprises Association warned.

title: Central Province to honour A/L high achievers on Sunday
byline: A programme to recognize district-level outstanding achievers of the 2023/2024 GCE Advanced Level Examination in the Central Province will be held on Sunday (14) in Kandy under the patronage of Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya.

title: Chinese Ambassador meets Ranil
byline: Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka Qi Zhenhong has held a special meeting with former President Ranil Wickremesinghe in Colombo.

title: Former Minister Shashindra Rajapaksa further remanded
byline: Former Minister Shashindra Rajapaksa was today ordered to be further remanded till September 19 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama.

title: Govt spends nearly Rs. 500 Mn on ex-Presidents, widows since 2017
byline: The government has revealed that a total of Rs. 491.2 million (Rs. 491,203,422) has been spent on expenses for former presidents and their widows from 2017 to the first six months of 2025.

title: Minister of Women’s Affairs insulted female MPs in Opposition
byline: Minister of Women’s Affairs Saroja Paulraj has insulted female MPs in the  Opposition through the remarks she made yesterday, MP Chamindrani Kiriella told Parliament today.

title: Two nabbed at BIA with phones, cosmetics, cigarettes worth Rs. 5 million
byline: Two passengers attempting to smuggle in mobile phones, tablet computers, cosmetics and a large stock of cigarettes and cannabis wrapping paper worth Rs. 5 million were arrested this morning by Customs officers at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA).

title: Two arrested for smuggling birds in Mannar
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy arrested two suspects who were trying to smuggle 91 birds near Sirithoppuwa beach in Mannar this week.

title: COPF proposes granting full independence to CIABOC
byline: The Committee on Public Finance (COPF) proposed  granting full independence to the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), by allowing the institution to manage its finances on its own.

title: No plans to shut down Ceylon Fisheries Corporation: Deputy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Fisheries Ratna Dhamija told Parliament today that there are no plans to shut down the Ceylon Fisheries Corporation, dismissing recent media reports claiming otherwise as false.

title: Doctor left patient for sex with nurse in operating theatre
byline: A married doctor had sex with a nurse in an operating theatre while a patient was under anaesthetic, a medical tribunal heard.

title: Mother, son hacked to death in Karandeniya
byline: Karandeniya Police have launched an investigation after a mother and son were founf  brutally hacked to death inside their home at Kotawela  in Karandeniya.

title: Ramith Rambukwella indicted for failing to declare assets acquired illegally
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has filed indictments against Ramith Rambukwella, son of former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, for failing to disclose assets worth over Rs. 270 million acquired illegally.

title: Ravi warns IMF reserve push could burden households
byline: UNP MP Ravi Karunanayake today cautioned in Parliament that Sri Lanka’s push to raise foreign reserves to USD 7.2 billion by December 2025 under the IMF’s Extended Fund Facility (EFF) could come at a heavy cost to households and small businesses.

title: Where the action unfolds: Venues that will host CWC25 games
byline: From Guwahati’s roar to Colombo’s charm, five iconic stadiums will see action during ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025.

title: Will not associate with Israel until peace dawns in Gaza Strip: Sajith
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said in Parliament that he stands firmly for protecting the rights of the Palestinian people because it is just and fair.

title: Kabir Hashim appointed as head of COPA
byline: Opposition MP Kabir Hashim has been appointed as chairman of the Committee on Public Accounts (COPA), the Parliament Media Unit said.

title: Former Catholic Church Media Director Fr. Benedict Joseph passes away
byline: Former Director of Media of the Catholic Church, Rev. Fr. Benedict Joseph, passed away this morning.

title: No decision yet on arresting Gammanpila: CID
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) today informed the Court of Appeal that no decision has yet been taken to arrest former Parliamentarian Udaya Gammanpila over a recent statement he had made to the media.

title: No action yet on Beira Lake stench despite promises: SJB Councillor
byline: Responding to a Daily Mirror article titled ’Strong stench from Beira Lake forces hotels to close,” SJB Council Member Chamith Wijesundara has criticised Colombo Mayoress Vraie Cally Balthazar for failing to address the issue, despite previous assurances.

title: NextGenSL holds constructive talks with US Ambassador Julie Chung
byline: NextGenSL met with US Ambassador Julie Chung on Tuesday afternoon for a productive discussion aimed at strengthening people-to-people ties between Sri Lanka and the United States, while advancing a shared vision of peace and prosperity.

title: Norwood three-wheeler accident: Six preschool children injured
byline: Six preschool children and a teacher were injured in a tragic accident this morning (12) on the Hatton–Bagawanthalawa main road in the Norwood Neweligama area.
